#Text=2. Data Acquisition and Methods
#Text=2.1. Data Acquisition
#Text=It is essential for researchers to quickly and accurately locate publications , using the search strategy and screen methods .
#Text=The article retrieval source for analysis was the SCI-E databases , which are frequently used in scientific research .

#Text=Several topic terms , including “ groundwater restoration ” , “ groundwater reclamation ” , and “ groundwater remediation ” , were used to retrieve publications that contained these words in publications ’ titles , keyword lists , and abstracts .
#Text=These terms helped to locate the majority of groundwater-remediation-related publications .
#Text=Though there may be other groundwater-remediation-related terminology , they account for a small percentage of publications and may have marginal relation to groundwater remediation research .
#Text=The search results have been refined or filtered by web of science categories , research areas , and document types .

#Text=To do this , several categories needed to be excluded , such as ( i ) unrelated categories — physiology , pharmacology pharmacy , genetics heredity — ( ii ) document types — book chapter , data paper , proceedings abstract — and ( iii ) research areas — imaging science
#Text=photographic technology , business economics .
#Text=The search resulted in 2867 publications dated from January 1950 to September 2018 .
#Text=The entire records , including the titles , abstracts , keywords , and references , were then exported for subsequent analyses .
#Text=Based on the frequency of groundwater remediation research over the past seven decades , we reviewed numerous studies published between 1950 and 2018 ( see the Supplementary Materials ) .
#Text=2.2. Scientometric Analytical Methods
#Text=Scientometrics , created by Tibor Braun , has been defined as the “ quantitative study of science and technology ” .
#Text=As a branch of informatics , scientometrics is used to analyze patterns in scientific literature quantitatively , to understand the knowledge structure of emerging trends in a research field .

#Text=As a scientometric approach , CiteSpace is used to clarify multidisciplinary relationships , assess research status , map knowledge domains , reveal research frontiers , and predict emerging trends , by analyzing the bibliographic records of associated publications .

#Text=In the net knowledge maps generated by CiteSpace , a node represents one item ( e.g. , country , author , subject , term , journal , or reference ) , and links describe co-citations or co-occurrences between these nodes .
#Text=Furthermore , each node is described as a series of tree rings of different colours , with blue representing the oldest and orange the most recent .
#Text=A purple ring around an item indicates good centrality .
#Text=To date , CiteSpace has been employed in studies of , for example , nonpoint source pollution , information sciences , psychological science , and global green innovation .
#Text=In this study , we produced and analyzed co-occurrence networks of subject categories and countries , and co-citation networks of journals , authors , and references using CiteSpace .
